intro: Oreinotinus acutifolius, commonly known as the narrow-leaved broom. It is a shrub native to the Mediterranean region, characterized by its slender, erect stems and narrow, linear leaves. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, typically in the spring. It is adapted to well-drained soils and full sun, making it suitable for rocky or dry environments. Oreinotinus acutifolius is often used in landscaping for its hardy nature and ornamental value.
